member.name: M:BottomNavigationBar.BottomBar.Attach(Android.App.Activity,Android.OS.Bundle)
member.summary: Bind the BottomBar to your Activity, and inflate your layout here. Remember to also call inside of your to restore the state.
member.param: an Activity to attach to.
a Bundle for restoring the state on configuration change.
member.returns: a BottomBar at the bottom of the screen.

member.name: M:BottomNavigationBar.BottomBar.AttachShy(Android.Support.Design.Widget.CoordinatorLayout,Android.OS.Bundle)
member.summary: Deprecated. Breaks support for tablets. Use instead.

member.name: M:BottomNavigationBar.BottomBar.AttachShy(Android.Support.Design.Widget.CoordinatorLayout,Android.Views.View,Android.OS.Bundle)
member.summary: Adds the BottomBar inside of your CoordinatorLayout and shows / hides it according to scroll state changes. Remember to also call inside of your to restore the state.
member.param: a CoordinatorLayout for the BottomBar to add itself into.
the view (usually a NestedScrollView) that has your scrolling content. Needed for tablet support.
a Bundle for restoring the state on configuration change.
member.returns: a BottomBar at the bottom of the screen.

member.name: M:BottomNavigationBar.BottomBar.HideShadow
member.summary: Hide the shadow that's normally above the BottomBar.

member.name: M:BottomNavigationBar.BottomBar.NoNavBarGoodness
member.summary: Prevent the BottomBar drawing behind the Navigation Bar and making it transparent. Must be called before setting items.

member.name: M:BottomNavigationBar.BottomBar.NoTabletGoodness
member.summary: Force the BottomBar to behave exactly same on tablets and phones, instead of showing a left menu on tablets.

member.name: M:BottomNavigationBar.BottomBar.GetBarSize(BottomNavigationBar.Listeners.IOnSizeDeterminedListener)
member.summary: Get this BottomBar's height (or width), depending if the BottomBar is on the bottom (phones) or the left (tablets) of the screen.
member.param: listener to get the size when it's ready.

member.name: M:BottomNavigationBar.BottomBar.NoTopOffset
member.summary: If you get some unwanted extra padding in the top (such as when using CoordinatorLayout), this fixes it.

member.name: M:BottomNavigationBar.BottomBar.UseOnlyStatusBarTopOffset
member.summary: If your ActionBar gets inside the status bar for some reason, this fixes it.

member.name: M:BottomNavigationBar.BottomBar.ToughChildHood(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Makes this BottomBar "shy". In other words, it hides on scroll.
member.param: Use extra offset.

member.name: M:BottomNavigationBar.BottomBar.UpdateTitleBottomPadding
member.summary: Material Design specify that there should be a 10dp padding under the text, it seems that it means 10dp starting from the text baseline. This method takes care of calculating the amount of padding that needs to be added to the Title TextView in order to comply with the Material Design specifications.

member.name: M:BottomNavigationBar.Listeners.IOnSizeDeterminedListener.OnSizeReady(System.Int32)
member.summary: Called when the size of the BottomBar is determined and ready.
member.param: height or width of the BottomBar, depending on if the current device is a phone or a tablet.

member.name: M:BottomNavigationBar.Listeners.IOnMenuTabClickListener.OnMenuTabSelected(System.Int32)
member.summary: The method being called when currently visible changes. This listener is fired for the first time after the items have been set and also after a configuration change, such as when screen orientation changes from portrait to landscape.
member.param: the new visible tab's id that was assigned in the menu xml resource file.

member.name: M:BottomNavigationBar.Listeners.IOnMenuTabClickListener.OnMenuTabReSelected(System.Int32)
member.summary: The method being called when currently visible is reselected. Use this method for scrolling to the top of your content, as recommended by the Material Design spec
member.param: the reselected tab's id that was assigned in the menu xml resource file.
